content: this legal text is about a mutual consent divorce agreement between mr nn and mrs bb they have decided to get a divorce and have asked a notary to record their property settlement agreements the notary has informed them of any conflicts of interest and imbalances and has given them the option to appoint another notary or seek legal counsel the notary has prepared a draft deed and sent it to the parties for review the parties have confirmed that they have been informed of the contents of the draft and have had enough time to provide any necessary information the notary will keep the original deed belgian law applies to the divorce as the parties are residents of belgium an inventory of the spouses assets may be drawn in advance to determine how they will be divided the spouses have made arrangements regarding their movable and immovable property including their financial accounts cars securities rental agreements life insurance policies and a bank vault they have also made arrangements regarding an immovable property they own including its location ownership history and any urban planning or environmental considerations the spouses have agreed to certain arrangements regarding personal income tax and property tax they have also made arrangements for the financial support and division of property for their child including a study allowance and the payment of extraordinary costs the costs of the divorce proceedings are shared equally between the spouses the jurisdiction for the proceedings is determined by the last marital residence and the family court in antwerp has jurisdiction in this case the procedure is initiated by submitting an application with the necessary documents the proceedings are conducted in writing unless the court orders a personal appearance the judgment is pronounced within one month after the public prosecutor submits their opinion the value of the property is estimated at €315000 the distribution duty has increased by 1 since the division of assets between the exspouses after their divorce the parties have granted power of attorney to a notarys clerk the deed of divorce was drawn up and signed by the parties and the court confirmed the allocation of property the agents involved have the authority to sign necessary documents and deeds the notary has confirmed the identity of the parties and a fee of €100 was paid the final deed was executed in the notarys office with all parties present
